metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14152 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A mishandled zero case was discovered in opj_j2k_set_cinema_parameters in lib/openjp2/j2k.c in OpenJPEG 2.2.0. The vulnerability causes an out-of-bounds write, which may lead to remote denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow affecting opj_write_bytes_LE in lib/openjp2/cio.c and opj_j2k_write_sot in lib/openjp2/j2k.c) or possibly remote code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14152` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.0-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.0-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.0-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.0-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> the fix for this CVE is incomplete, resulting in the vulnerability related to CVE-2017-14164.

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-1').
